thread.title: Batum helps Hornets stay unbeaten in preseason, beat Pistons
thread.title_full: Batum helps Hornets stay unbeaten in preseason, beat Pistons

title: Batum helps Hornets stay unbeaten in preseason, beat Pistons
text:
Sports Batum helps Hornets stay unbeaten in preseason, beat Pistons Detroit Pistons’ Andre Drummond (0) loses the ball against Charlotte Hornets’ Al Jefferson (25) while going to the basket during the first half of a preseason NBA basketball game Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015, in Auburn Hills, Mich. (AP Photo/Duane Burleson) more > By - Associated Press - Wednesday, October 21, 2015 
AUBURN HILLS, Mich. (AP) - Nicolas Batum had 18 points and 10 rebounds to help the Charlotte Hornets move to 7-0 in the preseason with a 99-94 victory over the Detroit Pistons on Wednesday night. 
HORNETS: Jeremy Lin had 18 points, while Al Jefferson had nine points in the second half. Troy Daniels added 15. 
PISTONS: Andre Drummond led the Pistons with 21 points and 15 rebounds. Reggie Jackson also had a double-double with 10 points and 11 assists. 
FREE THROW WOES: Drummond hasn’t fixed his free throw shooting problems. On a pair of foul shots he wasn’t close. The first was wide right, barely catching the edge of the rim, while the second was an air ball wide left. 
INJURY UPDATE: Detroit SG Kentavious Caldwell-Pope injured his left foot on a dunk in the first half and did not return to the game. X-rays were negative. 
UP NEXT: The Hornets finish the preseason Thursday at Indiana, while the Pistons play their last exhibition game Friday when they host the Hawks.
